column4: is there a way to burn the image to a USB and use that to install ubuntu? Right now i'm using slackware.
yes, see ubottu for detailed instructions but basically just use the usb-creator program
while there are windows instructions, there are also linux instructions.  Specifically, you can use usb-creator
usb-creator is in ubuntu repositories.  You can install that on slack if you want.  There's also unetbootin.  See which one is easier to install on slack
be more specific than "it doesn't work"
I boot from the USB it created and I get a bunch of 99's on the screen
what iso are you using? did you check the md5sum of the iso?
the iso downloaded from ubuntu.com ... didn't check the md5sum. Where can I find it?
the md5sum is correct
don't know.  Look into what genii said about 99s usually being associated with lilo.  Ubuntu doesn't use lilo by default
I have lilo because I use slackware, but I want to switch to ubuntu
lilo shouldn't really come into the picture if you are booting from the usb though and it seems it is
the ubuntu image should be on the usb?
yeah, unetbootin puts it there
it didn't put it on mine
maybe that's the issue.  What iso are you using?
should I put it there manually?
hmm, maybe unetbootin does something different.  I'm pretty sure at least usb-creator just had the iso on the disk
do you have a link for usb-creator for linux? I only found windows versions
package manager like apt-get
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ubuntu_Live_USB_creator I guess, though from experience it seems people usually have more luck with unetbootin
damn it ... usb-creator doesn't run on slackware and unetbootin doesn't do the job right
